result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica L Ransom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court withheld sentence, and gave the defendant credit for 3 days served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges during probation; civil judgment if not paid.
Pay supervision fees.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
No contact with victim that rises to the level of probable cause.

Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Defendant to comply with BMCW conditions.
If the agent needs to bring in the case back, she/he can contact the court.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to report within 1 week to serve this sentence.  The court will allow work and treatment release.  The court is also not opposed to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monica L Ransom

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Monica L Ransom in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court withheld sentence, and gave the defendant credit for 3 days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 7days in the House of Correction.  Defendant to report within 1 week to serve this sentence.  The court will allow work and treatment release.  The court is also not opposed to electronic monitoring.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Defendant to comply with BMCW conditions.
- No contact with victim that rises to the level of probable cause.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges during probation; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.

If the agent needs to bring in the case back, she/he can contact the court.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Received and filed:
Violation report.
cab

Defendant Monica L Ransom in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke who appears via telephone.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Matthew McCallum.  Case in court due to violation.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Sentencing on September 15, 2015 at 3:00 pm in Branch 36.

Violation report received and filed.
cab
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed office contact) received and filed.

Plea hearing continued, same appearances......
On oral motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Physical Abuse of a Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03 (3)(b), a Class I felony.  
As to count 1 as amended:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum receive   Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state, count 2 is dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Jury trial date of 08/24/2015 is vacated.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09/15/2015 at 03:00 p.m.

Defendant Monica L Ransom in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case is set for a final pretrial today.  Defense wants to leave on for trial.  The defendant was informed that after today the offer is revoked.  The state repeated the offer and now defense counsel wants to talk to her client.
Case passed...
Now back on the record, same appearances.
The defendant wants to change her plea....
Request for modification of the No Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Monica L Ransom in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: NLR- dob: 10/11/04 and NLR-dob: 10/19/99, unless as approved per Children's Court Orders or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfar.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Monica L Ransom in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Monica L Ransom in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. 
Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
